summary: RESOURCE_EXHAUSTED error occurs when describing a schedule that has been running for a while, causing the schedule workflow's consistent query buffer to fill up. The issue appears to be server-side rather than SDK-related.
userImpact: Users cannot describe schedules after they have been running for a period of time, preventing them from checking schedule status or making modifications.
rootCause: The Temporal Server's consistent query buffer for the schedule workflow fills up when too many queries are pending, potentially due to underpowered worker nodes or a bug in schedule workflow replay logic triggered by the specific schedule definition.
proposedFix: Upgrade Temporal server to the latest release; review cluster configuration and worker node capacity; examine the specific schedule definition that triggers the issue.
workaround: Delete and recreate the problematic schedule to temporarily resolve the issue.
keyQuote: The error most probably indicates an issue with your Temporal Cluster configuration, or a bug in the Temporal Server. In any case, this is not a TS SDK side bug.
